p.emph:
Miss Eartha M. M. White
President

div.p:
Pledge
"I promise to serve God and
Humanity and let Love reign
Supremely in my Heart"

We are firm in the belief that never so long as the miracle
of God’s Love continues to manifest itself in the world, will suf-
fering and unfortunate humanity fail to find champions and benefac-
tors. Fortified by this firmly entrenched belief, and becoming
rapidly, though reluctantly aware that our small and almost single-
handed efforts can no longer fully silence the piteous pleas for
assistance that reach our ears each day; we with confidence, make
this appeal to those who would find that sublime joy that comes from
an act of unselfish charity.

It is not expedient, and at this time surely not necessary
that we attempt to portray the hundreds of pathetic cases that have
come under our observation and care during the past year, for we may
see their counterparts enacted every hour of the day upon the streets
of thousands of communities throughout the nation. Suffice to say
that the organized charities have been overtaxed and unable to take
care of the needs of all. Among those rejected and those who
through ignorance have not known how to properly apply for aid, our
unflinching but deplorably inadequate efforts have been expended.

Last year the Clara White Mission: - - - - - - - -
Fed at the Free Soup Kitchen (since October 17, 1932 to date) from
fifty to one hundred fifty unemployed each day.
Furnished more than twenty thousand pints of milk to undernourished
children in the schools.

Carried three hundred Blind Orphans and Old People to an outing and
dinner at the beach.
Conducted a camp at Manhattan Beach for the Tubercular Suspects and
underprivileged children. Eighty-six were fed for one month.

Celebrated Mother’s Day with appropriate exercises, and distributing
Flour and vegetables to two hundred impoverished mothers.

Our Hope Department carried to homes, and to the sick, two hundred
and sixty baskets of groceries sufficient for a week.

p.emph: "We train, shelter, feed and clothe the needy"

div.p: Special religious and rehabilitation service were held at Duval County Prison Farm every Sunday during the year.
More than thirty-five hundred were given shoes and clothing.
These efforts have been supplemented this year:

The financing of a worthy girl in school.
The Establishment of a Free Roading Room in our Goodwill Center.
The Establishment of a Free Efficiency Training School for adults
in Home Making and Domestic Service and the operation of an agency
through which the qualified may obtain jobs.
Conducting a class in Red Cross First Aid Work.
The Establishment of an evening school in Business Training, with
courses in Shorthand and typing.
Making special investigations and giving help and hospitalization
to crippled children.
Opening forty domitories to shelter the stranded and homeless.

In a sentence, we do for Humanity what the Salvation Army
is doing for white people. The efforts of the Clara White Mission
have expended and used without regard for race or creed.

There are no slump periods in this business of relief, for
the sick, the halt, and the poor we have always with us. For them
the rise and fall of the stock market has no significance; they
are neither enriched nor further impoverished by any any change
in the governing parties. The stock ticker that records their destinies is the pulsation of the Human Heart, and the party of their
salvation is the party in whose heart Charity dwells.

Our immediate and most desired objective is to purchase
the property we now occupy. The cost will be twenty-five thousand
dollars ($25,00.00). The ownership of this building would assure
a permancy of our efforts, supplemented as it shall be by the dona-
tion of food and clothing from our friends.

We believe that your heart, like ours, is pained because
of this widespread suffering, and that our appeal shall not fall
upon deaf ears or closed purses. Your contribution, however small,
shall be payment in full for that priceless joy that is known only
to those who have given unselfishly in His name.
